CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01F06

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.ADDRESS: The Bridge, Buchanan Gate Business Park, Cumbernauld Road

TITLE.P: Ion Exchange Technology for Municipal Water Treatment

SHORT_DESCR.P: Scottish Water has a requirement to include ion exchange technology for organics removal, in municipal water treatment for systems up to 100 Ml/day. The scope of supply shall include, but is not limited: to the design, manufacture, supply, works testing, delivery to site, off-loading, moving into position, erection, installation, testing and commissioning of ion exchange plant and equipment and ion exchange resin. This scope shall include all major and ancillary plant and accessories necessary to form and/or integrate into an existing water treatment works a complete and robust system capable of organics removal in municipal water treatment. All systems, processes and components must be compliant with Scottish Water specifications and standards required and which are approved for use in Water treatment, complying with the Public Water Supply Scotland Regulations 2014 and/or

TITLE.P: Ion Exchange Technology Processes up to 1 Mld

SHORT_DESCR.P: Scottish Water has a requirement to include ion exchange technology for organics removal, in municipal water treatment for systems up to 1 Ml/day. The scope of supply shall include, but is not limited to: the design, manufacture, supply, works testing, delivery to site, off-loading, moving into position, erection, installation, testing and commissioning of ion exchange plant and equipment. This scope shall include all major and ancillary plant and accessories necessary to form and/or integrate into an existing water treatment works a complete and robust system capable of organics removal in municipal water treatment. All systems, processes and components must be compliant with Scottish Water specifications and standards required and be approved for use in water treatment, complying with the Public Water Supply Scotland Regulations 2014 and/or the Water Supply (Water Quality) Regulations 2016.

TITLE.P: Ion Exchange Technology Processes above 1 to 100 Mld

SHORT_DESCR.P: Scottish Water has a requirement to include ion exchange technology for organics removal, in municipal water treatment for systems above 1 Mld to 100 Mld. The scope of supply shall include, but is not limited to: the design, manufacture, supply, works testing, delivery to site, off-loading, moving into position, erection, installation, testing and commissioning of ion exchange plant and equipment. This scope shall include all major and ancillary plant and accessories necessary to form and/or integrate into an existing water treatment works a complete and robust system capable of organics removal in municipal water treatment. All systems, processes and components must be compliant with Scottish Water specifications and standards required and be approved for use in water treatment, complying with the Public Water Supply Scotland Regulations 2014 and/or the Water Supply (Water Quality) Regulations 2016.

TITLE.P: The Supply of Ion Exchange Resin for Municipal Water Treatment

SHORT_DESCR.P: The supply of ion exchange resin for municipal water treatment. Scottish Water has a requirement to include ion exchange technology for organics removal, in municipal water treatment for systems up to 100 Ml/day. The scope of supply shall include, but is not limited: to the supply of ion exchange resin capable of organics removal in municipal water treatment. All resins must be compliant with Scottish Water specifications and standards and be approved for use in water treatment, complying with the Public Water Supply Scotland Regulations 2014 and/or the Water Supply (Water Quality) Regulations 2016.

TITLE.P: Ion Exchange Technology Processes up to 1 Mld
Ion Exchange Technology Processes above 1 to 100 Mld
The Supply of Ion Exchange Resin for Municipal Water Treatment

INFO_ADD.P: The buyer is using PCS-Tender to carry out this procurement. Please note this is a separate website and if you are not registered, you must register via https://www.publictendersscotland.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk
Scottish Water will not accept the ESPD. We will only accept a completed Scottish Water PQQ document.

This Notice does not preclude Scottish Water from issuing other notices for specific requirements. Responses to the OJEU Notice will be evaluated and only successful applicants following PQQ evaluation will be invited to submit a tender. Scottish Water reserves the right to divide the scope of the contract into lots at tender and contract award stages as it deems appropriate. Applicants who fail to supply all of the information requested in response to this Notice or any resulting tender exercise may risk elimination.

ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.ADDRESS: The Bridge, Buchanan Gate Business Park, Cumbernauld Road
